title: noUnusedExpressions
description: Learn more about noUnusedExpressions
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
:::caution
This rule is part of the [nursery](/linter/#nursery) group. This means that it is experimental and the behavior can change at any time.
:::
## Summary
- Rule available since: `v2.2.5`
- Diagnostic Category: [`lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions`](/reference/diagnostics#diagnostic-category)
- This rule doesn't have a fix.
- The default severity of this rule is [**information**](/reference/diagnostics#information).
- Sources: 
  - Same as [`no-unused-expressions`](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-unused-expressions)

## How to configure
```json title="biome.json"
{
	"linter": {
		"rules": {
			"nursery": {
				"noUnusedExpressions": "error"
			}
		}
	}
}

```
## Description
Disallow expression statements that are neither a function call nor an
assignment.

When an expression is used as a statement, it should be explicitly clear
what the intention behind the expression is. This is clear for function
calls and assignments, because the call or the assignment itself is the
primary intention behind the statement. For other expression kinds, the
intention is much more ambiguous; it could be the expression contains
side-effects that are not very explicit, but it could also be that it is
an error where the author forgot to use the result of the expression,
such as a forgotten `return` keyword, or it could point to a function
that the author forgot to call.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
0
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>0<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. Set<number>

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.ts:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>Set&lt;number&gt;<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. Visit </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery">https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery</a></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> for more information.</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

```ts
1 as number
```

```ts
window!
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.ts:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>window!<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. JSX expressions are considered invalid when used as a statement too:

```jsx
<MyComponent />
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.jsx:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>&lt;MyComponent /&gt;<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. <></>

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.jsx:1:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>&lt;&gt;&lt;/&gt;<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>2 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. Visit </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery">https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery</a></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> for more information.</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

### Valid

```js
{} // In this context, this is a block statement, not an object literal

{ myLabel: foo() } // In this context, this is a block statement with a label and expression, not an object literal

function namedFunctionDeclaration () {}

(function aGenuineIIFE () {}());

f()

a = 0

new C

delete a.b

void a
```

### Handling of Directives

Any stand-alone string at the start of a script, module, or function is
considered a directive and is therefore allowed.

```js
"use strict";
"use asm"
"use stricter";
"use babel"
"any other strings like this in the directive prologue";
"this is still the directive prologue";

function foo() {
    "bar";
}

class Foo {
    someMethod() {
        "use strict";
    }
}
```

The following are **not** considered valid directives:

```js
doSomething();
"use strict"; // this isn't in a directive prologue, because there is a non-directive statement before it
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:2:1 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>doSomething();<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>2 │ </strong>&quot;use strict&quot;; // this isn't in a directive prologue, because there is a non-directive statement before it<br />   <strong>   │ </strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>3 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. Visit </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery">https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery</a></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> for more information.</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

```js
function foo() {
    "bar" + 1;
}
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:2:5 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>function foo() &#123;<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>2 │ </strong>    &quot;bar&quot; + 1;<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>    <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>3 │ </strong>&#125;<br />    <strong>4 │ </strong><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future. Visit </span><span style="color: lightgreen;"><a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery">https://biomejs.dev/linter/#nursery</a></span><span style="color: lightgreen;"> for more information.</span><br />  <br /></code></pre>

```js
class Foo {
    static {
        "use strict"; // class static blocks do not have directive prologues
    }
}
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:3:9 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-unused-expressions">lint/nursery/noUnusedExpressions</a> ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━<br /><br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">Expected an assignment or function call but found an expression instead.</span><br />  <br />    <strong>1 │ </strong>class Foo &#123;<br />    <strong>2 │ </strong>    static &#123;<br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>3 │ </strong>        &quot;use strict&quot;; // class static blocks do not have directive prologues<br />   <strong>   │ </strong>        <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><strong><span style="color: Tomato;">^</span></strong><br />    <strong>4 │ </strong>    &#125;<br />    <strong>5 │ </strong>&#125;<br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This expression may be unintentionally unused or it might be a function that you forgot to call.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: lightgreen;">ℹ</span></strong> <span style="color: lightgreen;">This rule belongs to the nursery group, which means it is not yet stable and may change in the future.
